intro: Apalophlebia venosa, commonly known as the veined apalophlebia, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its intricate, veined thallus that exhibits a unique pattern of growth and coloration. The plant thrives in specific microhabitats, typically on shaded, moist rock surfaces in temperate regions. Its morphology includes a foliose structure with distinct lobes and a complex arrangement of reproductive structures. Due to its limited distribution and specialized ecological requirements, Apalophlebia venosa is considered a valuable subject for botanical research.
